definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: When I went around to take up the tickets the child was bawling.
sentences.chinese: 我巡回收票时，那小孩子正嚎啕大哭。

sentences.english: The reasons for bawling differ too, the paper found.
sentences.chinese: 研究还发现，男性和女性嚎啕大哭的原因也有所不同。

sentences.english: BEIJING — Mothers wailing over the bodies of their children.
sentences.chinese: 母亲在孩子的尸体旁嚎啕大哭。

sentences.english: When he gave her a shot of Novocain, she began to cry.
sentences.chinese: 当医生给我女儿注射麻醉药时，她开始嚎啕大哭。

sentences.english: He returned a few minutes later, and the horse was bawling his eyes out.
sentences.chinese: 几分钟后，那匹马已经嚎啕大哭起来了。

sentences.english: Thee reasons for bawling differ too, the paper found.
sentences.chinese: 研究还发现，男性和女性嚎啕大哭的原因也有所不同。

sentences.english: But when I asked my mom what one was, she started crying.
sentences.chinese: 然而当我问起妈妈的时候，她却嚎啕大哭了起来。

sentences.english: of the plane. "I'm too young to die!" she wails.
sentences.chinese: “我还这么年轻，怎么能就这么死掉？”她嚎啕大哭。

sentences.english: Adrienne suddenly started crying and screaming in class today.
sentences.chinese: 艾德丽安今天在班上忽然就开始嚎啕大哭。

sentences.english: She cried inconsolably when her cat was run over by a car.
sentences.chinese: 一辆车碾了她的猫，使得她嚎啕大哭。

sentences.english: She wailed over her father's remains.
sentences.chinese: 她对着父亲的遗体嚎啕大哭。

sentences.english: That bad news caused her emotinal outburst.
sentences.chinese: 那件坏消息使她嚎啕大哭。

sentences.english: A woman began crying, saying a waitress was still alive in the rubble.
sentences.chinese: 一个妇女开始嚎啕大哭，说还有一个服务员埋在下面。

sentences.english: Thou weepest so that even a stone would show pity.
sentences.chinese: 您这样嚎啕大哭，就连石头听了都会心疼的呀。

definition: to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
to bawl/to cry/to wail/to howl/also written 號哭|号哭[hao2 ku1]
to weep disconsolately/to cry on each other's shoulder
to bury one's head in one's hands and weep (idiom)
